page.title: 04Henstead Church 2
page.content: Round the back there is an old shed in which the verger used to keep the tools for grave digging and for the up-keep of the cemetery. Nowadays the graves are dug by the funeral directors. There are about 500 graves in the cemetery but more people are being cremated. Inside the church there is a painting of the curcifixion by the pulpit and this was painted in 1870. By the font there is a painting of an old family coat of arms. In 1906 the old box pews were replaced by the present oak seatsand the church could hold a congregation of 116 adults. The front door was replaced at the same time and is made of some kind of pine. A set of stairs is found behind a doorway and is extremely old. Apparently these used to lead to some sort of platform. Other stairs are kept locked up as they are dangerous.
